message:
I tried using this (https://gist.github.com/1103389) in config.rb

page "/path.html" do
  @myvar = "foo"
end

...but am finding that all that is returned to the browser when viewing /path.html is the variable, and the page itself is not rendered. I.e. literally, all I'll see is "foo" on a blank page.
That syntax is only valid with the 2.0 betas (releasing next week). I'm afraid this feature isn't supported by the current 1.x release.
Thanks, I am using  2.0.0.rc3. I can wait till next week though, if it'll work then.
You could try the very latest beta. Hopefully the final will be out within the week.
Is there a way to make variables global to all the pages?
Then access it in templates: <%= settings.my_var %>
